adjectives.description: unexacting (comparative more unexacting, superlative most unexacting)

entries.meaning: (of persons, feelings, states of mind, etc.) Not demanding; uncritical; not difficult to satisfy.
examples: But Mrs Eames was a kind, patient, unexacting woman, who took all civil words as meaning civility.

entries.meaning: Not requiring precision or substantial effort.
examples: It . . . yields a staple which requires a very simple and unexacting process to prepare it for market.
